abstract: State Dept warns travelers that Iran nuclear deal does not change its risk assessment for travel to country, pointing to fact that Iran still holds in custody three American of Iranian descent.
lead_paragraph: In a warning issued on Wednesday, the agency said the recent nuclear deal “does not alter the United States’ assessment of the risks of travel to Iran for U.S. citizens.”

headline.main: State Department Cautions Americans Considering Travel to Iran
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Iran: State Department Warns Americans on Travel

snippet: In a warning issued on Wednesday, the agency said the recent nuclear deal “does not alter the United States’ assessment of the risks of travel to Iran for U.S. citizens.”
